mng: to tap, to knock (against sth hard), to knock (mud from boots, ashes from a pipe etc)

exm.mng: to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom), fig. to pound the ground with one's head
bumpy (of a road), limping (of a person)
to knock against, to bump into, to have a disagreement, to clash
